result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassandra J Haessly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Huber if approved by the jail administration.

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $200 plus costs.   
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Joint and Severally liable for restitution of $1,818.17.
Maintain employment, go to school or combination thereof.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Court will allow early discharge if she completes her conditions and agent recommends.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cassandra J Haessly in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
4:06 p.m. Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kessler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
90 days jail STAYED
Huber if approved by the jail administration. 
Placed on probation for a period of 30 months:
Pay fine of $200 plus costs.  (No DNA Surcharge)
50 hours community service.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Joint/Severally liable for restitution of $1,818.17.
Maintain employment, go to school or combination thereof.
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
Court will allow early discharge if she completes her conditions and agent recommendations.

Defendant Cassandra J Haessly in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler.  Elizabeth Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:50 a.m.  Court calls case, Atty Constable states appearances.  Court states this is a return on a Warrant.  Warrant is Quashed.  Atty Kessler states the Defendant had a plea hearing on April 17th, but had a medical emergency, and did not appear.  Atty Kessler states there is a Stipulation and Order waiting for Judge Finn's signature.  Another plea date will be scheduled. 

BTC:  Court will reinstate the bond, along with conditions.
cc: DA w/ minutes 4/20/15 ks
sent to JR 4/17/15 ks

Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:12 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Kessler indicates she has sent her client a number of letters and in the most recent letter she asked her to meet her at her office this morning.  
Court notes the plea was originally set for April 10th.   Notice was sent on April 8th to the Oakbrook Court address and neither was returned. 
Atty Kessler indicates she had asked for the new hearing date.  

BY THE COURT:  Bench Warrant. $1,500 cash alternative.

On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
